name: Ch15BBaseConvo5
_source: speak;Natasha;*cough*|The smoke... it's still in my lungs...
speak;Moulder;Take a moment to breathe, Sister Natasha.|You've been pushing yourself too hard.
speak;Natasha;Thank you, Father Moulder.|I... I don't think I've sat down since the fire began.
speak;Moulder;Nor have I.|So many wounded from the burning hall...|I fear my old bones aren't what they used to be.
speak;Natasha;Father, your hands are trembling.|You've expended too much of your healing energy.
speak;Moulder;As have you, my dear.|I can see the fatigue in your eyes.
speak;Moulder;Yet I fear our trials are not over.|Look to the horizon.
speak;Moulder;I'm afraid so.|It seems we've walked right into their trap.
speak;Natasha;*sigh*|Just when our allies need rest the most...|How can we possibly tend to more wounded?|My staff is nearly depleted, and I...
speak;Moulder;When you took up the healing staff, you made a promise to the divine.|To be a light in the darkness, to mend what is broken.|Even when your own strength fails.
speak;Natasha;You're right...|I just... I don't know if I have anything left to give.
speak;Moulder;Then we shall draw strength from each other.|I too took those vows, many years ago.|And in all my years of service, I have learned one truth:
speak;Moulder;The divine provides what we need, when we need it most.|Not before, not after.
speak;Natasha;I understand, Father.|Thank you for reminding me of my purpose.
speak;Moulder;Now, let us prepare our remaining staves and vulneraries.|The wounded will need us soon enough.
speak;Natasha;Yes.|While our friends fight, we shall be their shield.|Their comfort and their strength.
speak;Moulder;And remember, Sister Natasha...|We healers may not wield swords or lances,|but our role in this battle is no less vital.
speak;Natasha;I will not falter again, Father Moulder.|As long as one ally stands, I shall be there to mend their wounds.
speak;Moulder;Then let us make our preparations.|The battle approaches, and our friends will need every ounce of our skill.
speak;Natasha;Together, then.|May the divine light guide our hands.
speak;Moulder;Indeed.|Even in our exhaustion, we shall be the miracle our comrades need.
speak;Natasha;<green>Divine light, grant us strength...</>|<green>When our bodies fail, let our spirits endure...</>
speak;Moulder;<green>Guide our hands in the coming trial...</>|<green>Let no ally fall while we still draw breath...</>
